ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Only 1 error left in building Heritrix
ygData.msgSnippet: The src bundle is missing the directory of test documents used by the org.archive.util.ms.DocTest junit test.  You can see the complaint by looking in

The src bundle is missing the directory of test documents used by the 
org.archive.util.ms.DocTest junit test.  You can see the complaint by 
looking in  
$HERITRIX_HOME/target/test-reports/TEST-org.archive.util.ms.DocTest.txt.  
Then check out the referenced line 50:  
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/util/ms/DocTest.html#50.

(You'd think the fellas that made these bundles would at least try them 
before making a release: smile).

Try doing:

$ cd ${HERITRIX_SRC_HOME}
$ svn checkout 
https://archive-access.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/archive-crawler/trunk/heritrix/testdata

See if that fixes your issue.

St.Ack


Kaleb wrote:
>
> Okay, I'm now using Maven-1.2 and using the Heritrix-1.10.2-src and
> only have 1 failure left to figure out.
>
> [junit] Running org.archive.util.ms.DocTest
> [junit] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Time elapsed: 0.256 sec
> [junit] [ERROR] TEST org.archive.util.ms.DocTest FAILED
>
> BUILD FAILED
> File...... /home/user/.maven/cache/maven-test-plugin-1.6.2/plugin.jelly
> Element... fail
> Line...... 181
> Column.... 54
> There were test failures.
> Total time: 1 minutes 3 seconds
> Finished at: Wed Feb 28 16:56:43 CST 2007
>
> I have installed the maven-sdocbook-plugin-1.4.1.jar plugin and also
> the jimi-1.0.jar file. Does anyone have any idea what I'm missing?
>
